message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

The paper proposes a new approach for simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) that incorporates scene understanding. This involves inferring a directional segmentation of the scene and a semi-dense map while performing real-time camera tracking. Given that the paper deals with computer vision and robotics, it is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Robotics (cs.RO) categories. Additionally, the paper uses Bayesian nonparametric Dirichlet Process von-Mises-Fisher mixture model (DP-vMF) and conditional random field (CRF) techniques, which are commonly used in machine learning and artificial intelligence research (cs.LG, cs.AI). Finally, the paper deals with geometric scene understanding, which is related to the Graphics (cs.GR) category.
